title: Broad bean & mint dip
description: ”Great for early summer when fresh broad beans are in season. It goes well with roasted cherry tomatoes and crusty bread.” – Jane Muir, founder of Mildreds
ingredients: 500g frozen podded broad beans (use fresh if they’re in season)
7-8 sprigs fresh mint, leaves picked and chopped
Small bunch fresh flatleaf parsley, chopped

method.Step 1: Cook the beans in a pan of lightly salted boiling water for 3-5 minutes, then drain, reserving 150ml of the cooking water, and leave to cool.

method.Step 2: Peel the broad beans, then whizz in a food processor with the remaining ingredients until smooth, adding a little cooking water to loosen as needed. Season to taste and serve.
